results.title: Survival swimming. - [Rev. ed.]
results.brief_description: Children and adults are seen enjoying themselves in, and on, water, and two survival situations are depicted. Demonstrates treading water, endurance swimming (suitable strokes), surface diving, swimming under water, entry into water, exit and use of rope ladder. Designed to encourage swimmers to learn how to survive in emergency situations. Revised edition of Title Code 010476.
results.description: Children and adults are seen enjoying themselves in, and on, water, and two survival situations are depicted. results.title: Survival run
results.creator_credit: Robert Charlton, Joaquin Padro, Magus Films and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Presents the determination and cooperation between a blind man (Harry Cordellos) and his sighted partner (Mike Restani) when they took on the grueling Dipsea cross-country race over the California mountains and through rain forests. “The Dipsea Race is like life. You don’t win it…you survive it.” Harry Cordellos.

results.title: Survival of the fittest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Small Business”
Why small businesses grow or die - an investigation based on interviews with the principals of a number of firms, ranging from a one-man factory that is doing well to a dynamic enterprise. Gives examples of the special problems of those who inherit a family firm. Small firms are especially vulnerable but sometimes compensate with special satisfactions.

results.title: Survival
results.creator_credit: Eric L. Morris, Frank Killian and Movietone Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Review: 26th year”
Shows many birds and animals of Australia and their methods of survival, and contrasts them with man and his recklessness on the roads.

results.title: Survival
results.creator_credit: Robert Kruger and National Coal Board
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Mining Review: 26th year”
Space age technology has turned its hand to the saving of lives at sea. A revolutionary capsule, taking the place of the conventional lifeboat, goes through its paces rescuing men from a North Sea rig.

group_siblings.title: Survival

results.title: Surrealism and science: the weird world of Jean Painleve
results.brief_description: A compilation of nine films by Jean Painleve, scientist, pioneer scientific filmmaker and founder member of the Surrealist group. Painleve made over 200 scientific films, bridging the gulf that normally separates science from art and documentary from narrative cinema. Pioneering new techniques, he subverted the normally sober field of scientific studies by including outrageous jokes and comparisons in his underwater films and setting them to music ranging from Duke Ellington to Ravel. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Surrealism
results.creator_credit: George Barford, Egons Tomsons and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Traces the development of surrealism and its effect on modern art by studying the works of Ernst, Klee, Miro, Tanguy, Magritte, Dali and related painters outside the movement.
